item.title: Actions
item.description: Vim actions are essentially just when a user uses a Vim keybind. Things like yanking and pasting are Vim actions. This is not an “offical Vim thing,” just a Hilbish thing. The hilbish.vimAction hook is thrown whenever a Vim action occurs. It passes 2 arguments: the action name, and an array (table) of args relating to it. Here is documentation for what the table of args will hold for an appropriate Vim action.
